benchmark_details.name: AGNOSTOS
benchmark_details.overview: AGNOSTOS is a novel simulation benchmark designed to rigorously evaluate cross-task zero-shot generalization in manipulation, comprising 23 unseen manipulation tasks that differ from common training task distributions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the limits of vision-language-action (VLA) models in zero-shot generalization for robotic manipulation.

data.size: 3600 demonstrations for 18 seen tasks and 23 unseen tasks for testing
data.annotation: Data collected from demonstrations of robotic manipulation tasks

methodology.calculation: Mean and standard deviation of success rates over multiple trials.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate better generalization of VLA models to unseen tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against existing VLA models, including performance metrics reported.
methodology.validation: Evaluation on 23 unseen manipulation tasks categorized by difficulty.
